title: Polish butcher in court charged over Libby Squires murder
text:
Pawel Relowicz, 25, has been charged with the rape and murder of Libby Squire

A Polish butcher has appeared in court via video link charged with the murder and rape of student Libby Squire.

Pawel Relowicz, 25, spoke via an interpreter to confirm his name, age and nationality at a brief hearing at Hull Magistrates' Court today.

It is alleged that he raped the 21-year-old Hull University student on the night of January 30 this year and murdered her soon after.

Relowicz, of Hull, wore a grey t-shirt as he appeared via video link from Wakefield prison, where he is being held on remand.

He will appear at Hull Crown Court tomorrow. His solicitor, Bill Waddington, made no application for bail ahead of tomorrow's appearance.

Miss Squire, a philosophy and religion student, vanished near her home in Hull in the early hours of February 1, prompting a frantic search around the East Yorkshire city.

She had been out with friends and was turned away from the Welly nightclub in the city for being too drunk before being put in a taxi and driven home.

Miss Squire went missing after a night out in Hull. Her body was later found in the Humber

Her disappearance sparked a massive hunt that lasted nearly seven weeks as police searched a river and pond close to her home.

The search ended in heartbreak when police retrieved her decomposed body from Grimsby Docks on the Humber Estuary.

A post-mortem was conducted and her body sent for a series of tests.

On October 24, Humberside Police announced they had charged Relowicz with the rape and murder of Libby, originally from High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire.
description: Pawel Relowicz, 25, spoke via an interpreter to confirm his name, age and nationality at a brief hearing at Hull Magistrates' Court today.
